full_summary:
# Government Tender Announcement

## Project Title
Preventive Maintenance and Lead Abatement for Rubber Bullet Traps

## Contract Information
* **Reference Number**: cb-5018-38292479
* **Amendment Number**: 1
* **Solicitation Number**: PR77600 - 1000423299
* **Publication Date**: 2023-04-25
* **Tender Closing Date**: 2023-05-23T14:00:00 (expired)
* **Contract Start Date Estimated**: 2023-07-01
* **Contract End Date Estimated**: 2024-03-31
* **Contract Status**: Expired

## Procurement Details
* **Procurement Category**: SRV (Services)
* **Notice Type**: Request for Proposal
* **Procurement Method**: Competitive - Traditional
* **Selection Criteria**: Variations or combinations of the above methods
* **Limited Tendering Reason**: None

## Trade Agreements
This tender is open to contractors from various trade agreements, including:
* Canada-Panama Free Trade Agreement
* Comprehensive and Progressive Agreement for Trans-Pacific Partnership (CPTPP)
* World Trade Organization Agreement on Government Procurement (WTO GPA)
* Canada-Chile Free Trade Agreement
* Canada-Ukraine Free Trade Agreement
* Canadian Free Trade Agreement
* Canada-Korea Free Trade Agreement
* Canada-European Union Comprehensive Economic and Trade Agreement
* Canada-Honduras Free Trade Agreement
* North American Free Trade Agreement
* Canada-Peru Free Trade Agreement
* Canada-Colombia Free Trade Agreement

## Contract Location
The Canada Border Services Agency (CBSA) Main Campus in Rigaud, Quebec, Canada.

## Contract Description
The successful contractor will provide twice-yearly maintenance, lead abatement, and emergency service for two granular rubber bullet traps installed at the CBSA campus in Rigaud. The contract period is from the contract date to March 31, 2024, with an option to extend for up to five (5) additional one-year periods under the same conditions.

## Attachment
The tender notice is available for download from the Canada BPS website.

**Note**: I reformatted the text into a more readable and organized format, including clear headings and concise bullet points for easy reference. I also corrected grammar, spelling, and punctuation to ensure accuracy. The rewritten text adheres to a more professional tone and is within the 400-word limit.

Please provide any additional information if you would like
